avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is assessed as low. The few danger spots are located above 2000m in extremely steep, north-facing slopes and gullies that have not yet been unloaded. Spontaneous loose and wet-snow avalanches cannot be ruled out there.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small spontaneous loose and wet-snow avalanches possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowcover is till high altitudes wet or moist. On southern exposed slopes the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases. Some fresh snow is deposited on the wet old snow cover or on the warm meadow.

tendency.highlights: No significant change of the avalanche danger is expected.

weatherForecast.comment: Cloudy and wet mountain weather on Friday. It rains or snows repeatedly, the snowfall level is between 1600 m in the Northern Alps and 1900 m in the Gurktaler and Seetaler Alpen. Moderate north-westerly winds of 20 to 40 km/h. Temperatures at 2000 m are around 0 degrees.

customData.generalHeadline: Wet snow problem at high altitudes - low avalanche danger!
